name: Gene Spafford
background: Purdue professor, computer security pioneer. Analyzed Morris Worm. Founded CERIAS. Known for Spaf's Laws of security and advocacy for security education and ethics.

principles.name: The only truly secure system is one that is powered off
principles.description: Perfect security is impossible for functioning systems. Every operational system has attack surface. Security is risk management, not risk elimination.
principles.falsification: When specific threat models can be fully addressed with acceptable operational constraints

principles.name: Using encryption on the Internet is the equivalent of arranging an armored car to deliver credit card information from someone living in a cardboard box
principles.description: Endpoint security matters more than transport security. Encrypting communication doesn't help if endpoints are compromised. Secure the whole chain, not just visible links.
principles.falsification: When transport security addresses the actual threat model (e.g., network-level attackers)

principles.name: Security education beats security products
principles.description: Human factors cause most security failures. Training and awareness reduce risk more than tools. Invest in people, not just technology.
principles.falsification: When automated controls can genuinely remove human error from the equation
